Three salesmen sit a a table watching him. C.J. is the owner of Mason Marine. He's around 40, fit, white smile. Behind C.J. are several black and white pictures of he an his father fishing - one picture when C.J. is a young boy holding a toy TUG BOAT, one picture where C.J. is a teena and one more recent picture. Meet FRANK, 50ish, bearded, wearing a Hawaiian shirt, and stuffing a bear claw in his mouth; STEVE, looks like Neil Diamond in a shirt and tie; and KYLE, early 20's, spiked, frosted hair. C.J. You've got to create urgency with the customer. C.J. talks with a lot of intensity. He writes "Create Urgency" on the whiteboard and underlines it three times.

dialogues.text: This big bad boat is twelve thousand nine hundered and ninty-nine dollars. Do you want to pay with cash or credit card?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I really can't afford that much. Adam turns to leave. C.J. steps in. C.J. Suppose I could sell you this boat for a dollar? Would you take it right now? Adam turns back and looks at C.J. and Steve.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's hook it up to my truck. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  3*.

dialogues.text: Steve, C.J. and Adam look at the boat, which is now hooke to Adam's truck. C.J. Looks good, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It sure does. C.J. Now of course I can't sell it to you for a dollar. But what price did you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I was looking to spend around ten thousand dollars. C.J. What if I could make it happen for two fifty a month, would you take this boat home today? Adam rings his hands together nervously and thinks for a moment. C.J. What about two forty a month?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.J. writes "Follow Through" on the whiteboard and underl it four times. C.J. Follow through is everything in sales. If you're not going to follow through, you might as well not even be here. Frank takes a bite of his bear claw and NODS, clearly off space.

dialogues.text: Okay, great. I'll be here all week. Give me a call and let me know what she says. Frank turns and starts walking away. C.J. moves up next t Frank and turns him back around towards Patrick. C.J. Is your wife home now? Let's drive over and show it to her.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I think it would be better if I talked to her first. C.J. Okay. Let me get your phone number. I've got someone coming to look at the boat this afternoon. If they don't buy it, I'll give you a call. Patrick NODS. C.J. How late are you up?

dialogues.text: (sotto) You must mean your other wife.

You're going to be so happy with this boat. (and) Could you hold on a second? I have a call on the other line. (and) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: (into phone) It's time for bed!

dialogues.text: I was on the phone with his wife for four hours. I got a brain tumor, but I made the sale. Steve starts clapping. Kyle and Frank join in with him, although Frank's effort is half-hearted at best.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You're amazing, just amazing. That's a great sale, man. C.J. So let's make this our best month ever. Anyone who pulls a hat trick gets a two hundred and fifty dollar cash bonus.

dialogues.text: This is a great boat. I can just see you cruising through the harbor in this thing, everyone looking at you, all the chicks asking you for a ride. I could go out with you and be your wingman. The Stevester and Bill out on the water.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, sure. Listen I have to run. I have to meet my fiancee for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Oh, a romantic dinner? So you're setting her up for a little bit of the old in and out? Steve PUMPS his hips back and forth.

dialogues.text: You're going to need a boat. Unless the government does something about global warming, this whole place is going to be underwater. Forget Jesus, Al Gore is the only one who can save us now.

Kevin is Madeline's fath He's around sixty-five and in great shape, with a tattoo an eagle on his forearm. Tommy whacks the shuttlecock over to the other side of th net and it hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: Nice shot, Tommy! You're not like your father. You're a winner! C.J. Don't listen to your grandfather, Tommy. He's an insecure, egomaniac who resents me because I have a career that I'm passionate about.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: He's right, Tommy. I wish I'd barely gotten by selling used boats instead of fighting for our freedom and then having a very successful career in banking and vacationing in Europe. Not to mention a real house to raise my family in. C.J. Aren't you late for your next cocktail? Mr. Hofferman serves the shuttlecock hard and it hits C.J the chest. Ouch!

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: Victory!

dialogues.text: Down for twenty. Mr. Hofferman and Tommy drop to the ground and start doin push-ups.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: Tyler, come over here. You're a winner, too. You just ended up on the wrong team. Tyler runs over to Tommy and Mr. Hofferman and starts doi push-ups. Mr. Hofferman jumps up from doing his push-ups.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: Hooah!

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY AND TYLER
dialogues.text: Hooah! Madeline and MRS. HOFFERMAN exit the house. Mrs. Hofferma carries a cocktail and hands it to Mr. Hofferman.

dialogues.text: There's an open house across the street. Since you're so successful selling used boats, why don't we go take a look at it. C.J. That sounds like a fantastic idea.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: Great. Let's go. As Mr. Hofferman turns away, C.J. scratches his forehead his middle finger.

dialogues.text: The house is gorgeous. A lush green lawn leads up to two pillars on either side of a large, dark wooden door.

dialogues.text: C.J., Madeline, Tommy, Tyler, and Mr. and Mrs. Hofferman enter. A huge chandelier hangs down from the second story. A lar staircase leads up. The house is elegant and enormous. JOHNNY CROSS (age 35), the realtor, tall and handsome, strides towards them oozing used car salesman charm.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: How are you folks today?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: Fine, thank you. We live across the street, but wanted to bring our daughter and son-in-law over to see the place.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: They really can't afford it. He sells used boats.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Actually, you might be surprised. There are some very creative loan options out there.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: You'd have to be Michelangelo to create that loan. C.J. I sell a lot of boats, and we have considerable equity in our house.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  24 25 10.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I'm sure we can work something out. Obstacles are meant to be overcome. Mr. Hofferman rolls his eyes as he continues to do reps w the dumbbells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny, C.J., Mr. and Mrs. Hofferman, Madeline, Tyler, an Tommy enter. The living room is every bit as elegant as t rest of the house, with a huge sprawling kitchen on one s and a great living area on the other. Two french doors le out to a huge backyard.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: What ungodly amount of money are they asking?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Seven and a quarter. The phone hasn't stopped ringing since they listed it. I'm tempted to buy it myself and flip it. Johnny pulls a mini-football out of his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Hey, kids. Why don't you go outside and throw the football around. It's a great backyard.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY AND TYLER
dialogues.text: Yeah! Johnny tosses the football to Tommy as they run outside.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: I'll keep an eye on them. Mrs. Hofferman goes out after them.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: If you married Blake Frasier, you'd be living here now.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: Blake used to wear dresses and loved musicals.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: That's absurd. He was a marine.

25 C.J. Come on, Kevin. Like you never soaped up with your platoon mates.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: You watch your tongue!

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: Enough!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: What is your current payment? C.J. Around eighteen hundred per month.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: So if I could get you into this house for around the same amount, you'd put in an offer today? C.J. Yeah, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: How much equity do you have in your house? C.J. About a hundred thousand. Johnny whips out a calculator and starts inputting number

dialogues.text: If you could put down one-fifty, and placed an offer of seven hundred, and took a fifty year mortgage, your payment would only be around twenty- four hundred. That's pretty close to your current payment.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: Not really. C.J. A fifty year mortgage? I'm forty-one years old.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but we can't afford this place.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: You're wasting your time. Mickey Mouse has bigger balls than he does. Madeline gives her father a look. He looks away and start doing reps again. C.J. rings his hands together nervously. A long beat, and then -- C.J. (with renewed confidence) Let's put in the offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.J. and Madeline enter. Madeline starts quickly undressi She's pissed. C.J. We've always wanted to live ina house like that.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: How are we going to afford an extra six hundred dollars a month? C.J. Don't worry. It's going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: Did you think about the property taxes? The taxes are going to be three times what they are on this place. C.J. Just trust me on this. I got it.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: And how in the world are we going to come up with a hundred and fifty thousand dollars? We're lucky if we have eighty-five in this place. C.J. I'm going to be making some major changes down at the shop.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? C.J. I'm going to hire some new guys who are really motivated to sell. And if the old guys don't step up, I'm going to let them go.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: You've been saying that for five years. You're too nice. You're never going to let them go. C.J. Once I get some better sales guys, I'm going to make them commission only. It'll starve the beast. They'll either sell or they won't make any money. Madeline pulls off her earrings and sets them on the coun C.J. Let me do this for our family. C.J. moves up behind Madeline. C.J. We can't let fear run our lives.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: Okay, mister infomercial, I'm not letting fear run my life. I'm letting reality run my life. Madeline rolls her eyes and walks into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deck is roped off like a dock and has several pieces patio furniture on it, including a table and chairs.

dialogues.text: Frank eats a doughnut. Steve sits at the table drinking D Coke. Kyle sits next to them writing in his notebook and DRUMMING out beats on the table. Steve lights a cigarette and offers one to Kyle, who acce it. Frank fans the smoke away, annoyed.

dialogues.text: He may sell twice as many boats as I do, but I have balance in my life. Do you know what I was doing last night while he was selling boats?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Petting the one-eyed snake?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No, asshole. I was coaching my daughter's soccer team in the regional quarterfinals.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Same difference. Kyle continues drumming on the table.

dialogues.text: (to Kyle) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I'm writing a new song, man.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: All the great rock was written in the seventies. You should write a song like Stairway To Heaven. Led Zeppelin was the greatest band of all time.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You're high, dude. We're way better than Led Zeppelin. You should see my guitar player. He's a lot better than that guy... what's his name?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Jimmy Page? Your guitar player is better than Jimmy Page?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, a lot better.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What's his name, Eddie Van Hendrix?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No, his name is Mike.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Forget it. Kyle goes back to writing in his notebook.

dialogues.text: Frank shoots Steve a look and Steve winks at him.

dialogues.text: Kyle, since you're the new guy, why don't you take this one.

dialogues.text: That guy? He looks homeless.

dialogues.text: The ones who look like that have all the money.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I'll take him, but when I sell him that Four Winns cabin cruiser, don't come crying to me. Steve stands up. Kyle glances at him and then stands up.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I got it. Kyle moves out toward Harvey.

29 Kyle turns his head and shoots Steve and Frank a really m glance.

dialogues.text: Steve and Frank bust up LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I buried two of the boats in the ground and made septic tanks out of them.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Septic tanks?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I just put some old plywood over them and ran the plumbing to my trailer.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it works great. The third boat runs pretty well, and I want to take it to Mexico. 30 31 Kyle just NODS his head as Harvey continues to RAMBLE on.

dialogues.text: Steve stands talking to a young couple, beside a ski boat. DAN and DEBBIE, In the background, Kyle still talks to Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I'm envious. You guys are going to have a great summer! Let's go in and finish up the paperwork. You'll have to take the Stevester skiing sometime. Steve extends his hand to both of them and they shake.

dialogues.text: C.J. stands at the counter talking to Kyle. 32 33

dialogues.speaker: C.J.
dialogues.text: You're helping Harvey?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You know that guy? C.J. He comes in here all the time. If you want to be successful in sales, you have to know the difference between light and heat.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: He's cool. I won't spend too much more time with him. Kyle exits. Steve enters carrying a stack of papers.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I just sold that Larson out there. Made a great deal on it. C.J. Did you up sell any accessories?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Nah, they could barely afford the boat. C.J. Finance the accessories.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll talk to them about that as an option. Frank's sits at the counter. He looks up at Steve and C.J and notices Dan and Debbie standing outside.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Did you just sell to that couple?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, why?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That's my be-back. I talked to them last week!

dialogues.text: (to Steve, pointing at his pad) Here, right here, Dan and Debbie! Steve rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You're the "half deal" king because you can't close anything yourself. This is my deal.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to C.J.) C'mon C.J., you know this is half my deal. Frank shows C.J. his pad of paper. C.J. Steve, it does look like he talked to them last week.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: C'mon C.J., quit standing on my dick! Whoever closes the deal should get the money. I'm just going to start taking down names and taking half deals. That'd be a hell of a lot easier than closing them. C.J. You know the rules.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (to Frank) Then you go out there and up sell the accessories. C.J. Yeah, that's a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Forget it. You can have it. C.J. What? Where is your motivation? I'll go out there and sell them the accessories myself! C.J. angrily snatches the paperwork out of Steve's hand a walks out the door. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  19.

dialogues.text: C.J., Frank and Steve wave as Dan and Debbie drive away i their SUV towing the boat. The SUV is packed with accessories, literally falling out windows -- life jackets, rubber bumpers, anchors, ropes, fire extinguisher, a boat cover, water skis, a wake board and a huge inflatable yellow hotdog wave rider strapped t the roof. C.J. You know what guys? I've had it! You guys are -- MUSIC blares as Johnny pulls up in his Corvette. C.J. tur and sees Johnny Cross.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Hey, Captain, so this is your lot? Johnny steps forward and holds out his hand to Frank and Steve.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Johnny Cross. A pleasure to meet you. They shake hands. C.J. Have you heard anything on my offer?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: It's being handled by another agent in the office. I'm getting out of real estate. C.J. Really?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: That's actually why I came by. (beat) I've sold all kinds of stuff from lemonade when I was a kid to cars to real estate, and I've always been the best. And while I love to sell, I've never loved what I was selling. Frank rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: When I was a kid, my grandfather used to take me fishing. (more)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  20.

dialogues.text: Is he out of jail? Yeah, he worked for us for a few months. Sold a lot of cars. Stole a lot of money, too. Then he got in a fight with the sales manager and nearly killed him. And we had a mysterious fire the night before he disappeared. If you're thinking of hiring him, and you also have Satan as a candidate, hire Satan. C.J. (into phone) Okay, thanks. C.J. hangs up the phone, leans back in his chair, and breathes deeply.

It's long, sleek, shiny and says "look at me." C.J. exits the building as Manas jumps out of his Range Rover, followed by his enormous BODYGUARD. Manas has on white shorts and an untucked button-down shirt exposes hi gold chain and hairy chest. He wears Gucci sunglasses and speaks with a thick Armenian accent. As C.J. approaches, Manas holds out his hand and they sha

dialogues.text: Thanks, man.

dialogues.text: But it's just not quite the right sound for our label. There's an awkward silence as the band looks at each othe Kyle squeezes his hands really tight as he thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I heard that's what they told the Beatles.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW LASER
dialogues.text: Trust me, you guys aren't the Beatles. Laura will show you out. Kyle stands up. Andrew and his team start packing up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Thank you for your time. We hate to run, but we're going to be late for our meeting over at Capitol.

dialogues.text: Who are you meeting over at Capitol?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Uh... Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW LASER
dialogues.text: Eddie who?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Eddie Van Hendrix.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW LASER
dialogues.text: Well, good luck. Kyle and his band turn to leave. But then Kyle turns back Andrew Laser.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What if we toured the country, paid all our own expenses, and gave you all the profits. Would you sign us?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The record executives look at each other and smile, not s what to make of Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW LASER
dialogues.text: Why, is your dad a millionaire?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No, but if we could present you with a no lose situation, would you sign us? If we paid all our own expenses, did all our own booking and promotion, you wouldn't have to do a thing, and we gave you all the profits, would you sign us?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW LASER
dialogues.text: Sure. Do you guys want to do that?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Well, we can't exactly do that. But let's say we paid half our expenses and gave you half the profits?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW LASER
dialogues.text: No, I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Okay, how about we pay sixty percent of the expenses and we get half the profits?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW LASER
dialogues.text: Okay, we'll split the profits but you guys have to pay seventy percent of your expenses.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Deal. Kyle holds out his hand and they shake.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW LASER
dialogues.text: Welcome to Laser Records.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: We're going to sell more records than any band, ever. All the other band mates look at each other wondering wha just happened. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  63%.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM

dialogues.text: Are you Johnny? Alan said -- E.) And another customer, DAVE --

dialogues.text: Hey is Johnny around? Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  132 133 134 135 136 79.

dialogues.speaker: C.J.'S OFFICE 132
dialogues.text: Johnny hands Madeline some paperwork. Madeline starts add blue above Johnny's name.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEBOARD
dialogues.text: The bar graph shows C.J. ahead of Johnny until Madeline a the recent sale, which puts Johnny at $14,000 and C.J. at $12,000.

dialogues.speaker: LOT 133
dialogues.text: A.) Johnny talks with a customer, DARYL.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: I saw your ad in the paper for the 17 foot Whaler?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, we just sold that one, but let me show you another boat. It's actually a much better deal. B.) C.J. talks to a customer, DYLAN. C.J. I'll take you out on your new boat and teach you how to operate it. As many private lessons as you need, for free.

dialogues.speaker: C.J.'S OFFICE 134
dialogues.text: C.J. sits at his desk and pulls out a stack of papers. He picks up the phone. C.J. (into phone) Hey Jeff, this is C.J. down at Mason Marine. I sold you that 17' Larson last year...

dialogues.speaker: LOT 135
dialogues.text: C.J. stands with JEFF. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: DECK 136
dialogues.text: C.J. talks with his family.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  80.

dialogues.speaker: C.J.
dialogues.text: We need bodies in here. Go through the customer database and call all our past customers and tell them we're having the biggest sale of all time!

dialogues.speaker: RETAIL SPACE 137
dialogues.text: A.) Madeline talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: Do you have any interest in upgrading your boat? We're having a huge sale. B.) Mr. Hofferman talks on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: Always good to talk to a fellow marine. Hey, bring your boat down here and we'll give you top trade in value... C.) Tyler talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Are you interested in a boat upgrading? (and) I'm six.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEBOARD
dialogues.text: Madeline adds to C.J.'s total. The bar graph shows that C has $23,500 and Johnny is at $36,000. Madeline pulls out her cell phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Frank, it's Madeline. C.J. really needs your help...

dialogues.speaker: LOT 139
dialogues.text: A.) C.J. stands with another customer, HARRY. C.J. I'll tell you what, if you buy it today, I'll deliver the boat to your brother in Vermont.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  81.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: B.) Johnny talks with another customer, ROBERT.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: So do you want the windshield with the boat, too?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: It doesn't come with the windshield?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: No, but if you buy this boat today with the windshield upgrade, I'll give you three thousand dollars cash back. You just can't tell my manager. Johnny pulls out a wad of hundered dollar bills from his pocket. C.) Frank, Steve, and Kyle walk onto the lot and approach Madeline.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: These two jokers decided to tag along.

dialogues.speaker: RETAIL SPACE 140
dialogues.text: Frank, Steve, Kyle, and C.J.'s family all talk on their c phones.

dialogues.speaker: LOT 141
dialogues.text: Frank and Steve flank C.J. as he shakes hands with a customer, JOE. There is only one boat left on the lot, an 18' Larson bowrider.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEBOARD
dialogues.text: Johnny is at $60,300 and C.J. is at $59,600.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone sits on the deck.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  81aA*.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: We almost starved out on the road. That deal I made was crap. I won't make that mistake again.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: If you guys really are as good as Zepplin, you'll get some more chances.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Thanks man, I really hope so. C.J. and Johnny stand on the deck looking at the lot entr like a couple of hungry wolves. Suddenly Harvey appears a the gate. He starts walking towards the deck.

dialogues.speaker: C.J. /JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Mine!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Back off, I said it first. That's my customer. C.J. You're crazy! That was all me. Harvey has slowed, watching C.J. and Johnny. Johnny turns and starts walking toward Harvey. C.J. quick follows, grabbing Johnny's arm. Harvey sees Johnny and C.J. coming toward him. He nonchalantly turns and starts walking back out of the lot

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (to Harvey) Hey, Harvey. How's it going? Johnny sprints after Harvey, followed by C.J. C.J. How did you hear about our sale? We only have one boat left!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: It was my grandfather's boat. He took really good care of it. C.J. Would you buy this boat for a dollar?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I'll come back later. I just needed an anchor for my automatic toilet flusher. C.J. There won't be any later.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Harvey, why don't you at least take a look at our last boat? We're parctically giving it away. I know you like bargains. C.J. What do you have to lose by looking?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You know, I was thinking about taking a voyage to Indonesia this summer.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: This is the perfect boat. 144 Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  83%.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.Jd., Johnny and Harvey stand looking at the Larson. C.J. I can get you into this boat for $299 per month. Johnny steps between C.J. and Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Buy it from me and I'll throw ina lap dance at the Horny Bunny. You know what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: How much does it weigh? I want something light so I can add solar panels to it and still cruise at ten nautical miles per hour.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: This is one of the lightest boats ever made. It'll be perfect. C.J. steps in front of Johnny. C.J. The dry weight of this boat is eighteen hundred pounds. You'll have no problem adding some solar panels to it.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Maybe this is the boat for me. I'm going to need brackets and deep cycle batteries with at least 540 cranking amps. Johnny steps in.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Harvey, Crazy Johnny is making deals today. I'll throw them all in for free. Johnny holds out his hand to Harvey. C.J. He's actually not athorized to give away free accessories. But I am. I'll throw them all in free of charge.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What about a GPS with side imaging technology?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  83A-85*.

dialogues.speaker: C.J.
dialogues.text: Yes. I'll throw that in for free, too. Behind them, Johnny picks up a wooden paddle. Frank, Stev and Mr. Hofferman run off the deck and up next to Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I was just kidding around. Johnny drops the paddle. He looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What about an anchor, bumpers and a VHF radio? C.J. Yes, yes, I'll throw it all in. Do we have a deal? Johnny steps in between Harvey and C.J.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: He doesn't even have any VHF radios. C.J. I've got a whole case of them inside.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: You better take a look at it. I think we sold the last one yesterday. And I don't think he has any GPS's either.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I want to see the accessories. C.J. sighs and walks towards the retail space. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.J. moves around the room grabbing accessories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, C.J. exits the retail space with an armload of accessories. He approaches Harvey. C.J. I've got them all right here. So we have a deal, right? C.J. holds out his hand to Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry Captian, I just sold this boat. The CAMERA PANS over to reveal Johnny standing with Alan. Johnny holds a handful of cash.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: He paid cash. (shaking Alan's hand) You're going to be very happy with this boat. 86%.

dialogues.speaker: 145B
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  87.

dialogues.speaker: DECK
dialogues.text: C.Jd., Steve, Frank, Kyle, Madeline, and Mr. and Mrs. Hofferman sit on the deck in silence. C.J. looks like a boxer whose just gotten pummeled for ten rounds. Alan drives his truck away towing his new boat. Johnny approaches the deck.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Nice try.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: It's not six o'clock yet. There's still five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but too bad there's no more boats to sell. I'll take the cash today and I'll be back on Monday for the credit card purchases. C.J. gets up and goes into the retail space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Tyler play with Tuggy the tug boat. C.J. Come on, we're getting ready to leave. C.J. grabs Tommy's hand Tommy hands Tuggy to C.J. A realization crosses C.J.'s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.J. exits Mason Marine with Tuggy. He sets it down on th deck, where everyone sits. C.J. This is the last boat for sale on the lot. Maybe ever. This is no ordinary boat. This has been my personal boat for the last 37 years and it's always been stored indoors. That isn't to say it hasn't gotten used much. On the contrary, when I was a kid I took this boat from the creek in my backyard in Georgia to ports all over the world. (more)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  88.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: C.J. (cont'd) We pulled tankers to safety, rescued people from boats that were sinking, saved the girl next door from a big water monster, and trandsported a salamander down river to a new home. This isn't just some boat, this is a legend. (picking the boat up and turning it over) Considering its age, it only has minor scratches, no major damage at all. It is an extremely low maintenance boat. The buyer of this boat will recieve a lifetime warranty bow to stern, free delivery anywhere in the world, and unlimited free storage if you're local. All this for the unbelievable low price, for the next... (looking at his watch) three minutes, of thirteen thousand dollars. A long beat. Everyone looks at each other, gets it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'll take it.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Too bad your broke-ass doesn't have thirteen thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (to Frank) You want to partner up? I'll kick in a thousand if you do.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I got a '57 Stratocaster that's worth like two G's.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: No, no, no, that's bullshit. That's not even a real boat.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: Count me in for the rest. C.J. Sold!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  89.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Oh, man, that's a great sale. Too bad you only have one minute to come up with the money. Mr. Hofferman pulls out his gold card.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: Put it all on this. I've got unlimited credit. I know everyone else is good for it. Johnny is furious and starts toward C.J.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: You're going to give me my money or I'm going to kick your ass. Everyone on the deck stands up and Johnny stops in his tr

dialogues.speaker: MR. HOFFERMAN
dialogues.text: I wouldn't come any closer if I were you. Johnny hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: This isn't the end of this. Johnny turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FRONT GATE 149
dialogues.text: TINA, the receptionist from Greenville Ford, and two POLI OFFICERS enter.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: That's him! That's the no good used car salesman! The officers approach Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: We have a warrant for your arrest for not paying child support.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Johnny tries to walk past Policeman #1 and Policeman #2 s in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Get on your knees, hands behind your back, now!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  149 150 151 90.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I've never seen this bitch before in my life. Johnny keeps walking past the cops. Policeman #1 pulls ou a stun gun and tazers Johnny. Johnny shudders and falls t the ground. On the deck, everyone CLAPS and CHEERS. Especially Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.J. enters and sits down at his desk. Madeline enters. C.J. After I pay back the consignment money and settle the lawsuit, I'll be left with nothing and no inventory to sell, either. Madeline pulls out a wad of CASH from her purse.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: You forgot about the five thousand he left. C.J. stands up and gives her a huge hug. C.J. I'm sorry. I really wanted to get you the bigger house.

dialogues.speaker: MADELINE
dialogues.text: I know. And that's what I love about you. But I've always been happy in our small house. It just makes us a closer family. They share a hug and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 23' Seaswirl motors along the ocean. C.J., Madeline, Mr Hofferman, and Mrs. Hofferman eat, drink, and LAUGH. PULL BACK TO REVEAL Tommy and Tyler being towed behind th boat on a yellow inflatable hotdog. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: OVER ENDING CREDITS
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  g1*,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle talks with a MILD MANNERED CUSTOMER.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Let me ask you a question. If I were to offer you this boat for a dollar, would you buy it today?

dialogues.speaker: MILD MANNERED CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What? You wouldn't? For one dollar?

dialogues.speaker: MILD MANNERED CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what I want yet. Kyle pauses, not sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: How about fifty cents?

dialogues.speaker: LOT
dialogues.text: Frank talks to an OLD CUSTOMER.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Can I get your name and number and I'll call you if something else comes in?

dialogues.speaker: OLD CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well, okay, give me a call if you change your mind. Frank turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: LOT
dialogues.text: Steve talks with a THIN CUSTOMER. The boat is hooked up t his truck.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It looks good, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: THIN CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: It sure does.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something. Would you buy this boat for one dollar?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  92.

dialogues.speaker: THIN CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: Sold! The thin customer stuffs a dollar bill into Steve's front pocket.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I can't sell you this for a dollar.

dialogues.speaker: THIN CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No, no, no, you said it was a dollar and I've already paid you. The thin customer jumps into his truck and drives away to the boat. Steve runs along side of him banging on the win

dialogues.text: Stop! The end Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
